GEO BON with its scientific partners introduced in 2015 a new generation of global indicators integrating biodiversity observations, [remote sensing data](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41559-021-01451-x), and models for assessing progress towards the CBD Strategic Plan (see [here](https://www.geobon.org/downloads/biodiversity-monitoring/technical-reports/GEOBON/2015/GBCI-Version1.2-low.pdf)). In 2020, the GEO BON network developed a technical [tecnichal document](https://www.cbd.int/doc/c/60fe/c885/c309aa2a521eb0fec8f892c4/sbstta-24-item3-geobon-technical-support-en.pdf) to support the effective monitoring of [goals and targets](https://www.cbd.int/doc/decisions/cop-15/cop-15-dec-04-en.pdf) for the pots-2020 biodiversity framework.

Indicators (headline indicators[^1], component indicators[^2] and complementary indicators[^3] are summarized in the [CBD/COP/DEC/15/5](https://www.cbd.int/doc/decisions/cop-15/cop-15-dec-05-en.pdf) (19 December 2022) and here [post-2020indicators.org](https://www.post-2020indicators.org/).

[^1]: Headline indicators capture the overall scope of the goals and targets of the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework to be used for planning and tracking progress as set out in decision 15/6. They are nationally, regionally and globally relevant indicators validated by Parties. These indicators can also be used for communication purposes.

[^2]: Component indicators: a list of optional indicators that, together with the headline indicators, cover components of the goals and targets of the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework which may apply at the global, regional, national and subnational levels.

[^3]: Complementary indicators: a list of optional indicators for thematic or in-depth analysis of each goal and target which may be applicable at global, regional, national, and subnational levels;

For the ecosystem services component we rely on a recent publication from the Ecosystem Services team (see [Balvanera et al 2022](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1877343522000045?fr=RR-2&ref=pdf_download&rr=7c54f0ee4f89c3a5)).

For some attempts to build a composite indicator see ([Rouge and Schlosser 2023](https://globalchange.mit.edu/sites/default/files/MITJPSPGC_Rpt365.pdf)).
